bill.title: Improving Broadband Access for Veterans Act of 2016

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 162, Number 145 (Monday, September 26, 2016)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. McNERNEY:H.R. 6165.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the Constitution of the UnitedStates grants Congress the authority to enact this bill.[Page H5913]

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 637.

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Improving Broadband Access for Veterans Act of 2016

This bill requires the Federal Communications Commission to release a notice of inquiry that seeks public comment on the development of rules to promote broadband Internet access service for veterans, in particular those with low-incomes or who reside in rural areas.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.title: Improving Broadband Access for Veterans Act of 2016
To require the Federal Communications Commission to take action relating to promoting broadband Internet access service for veterans.
Improving Broadband Access for Veterans Act of 2016

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
